Miscellaneous Highlights: Olympic Gold medalist Simone Biles and her husband, Chicago Bears safety Jonathan Owens, sat court-side at the United Center for Thursday's game between the Bulls and Minnesota Timberwolves.
A.J. Pierzynski revealed that he and other Sox teammates at the time were involved in a video montage aimed at recruiting LeBron James to sign with the Bulls.
Others: Joe Cowley of the Chicago Sun-Times reports that rival NBA teams believe Bulls executive Arturas Karnisovas may pivot to exploring trades for guards Ayo Dosunmu and Coby White if he can't find suitable trades for Zach LaVine, Nikola Vucevic, or Lonzo Ball.

Former Bulls guard Alex Caruso and current roster pieces Matas Buzelis and Julian Phillips appeared on Bucknell Sports Analytics' PEST metric rankings list, which measures the most aggressive perimeter defenders in the NBA using the league's player-tracking data.

Beloved former Chicago White Sox catcher and 2005 World Series champion A.J. Pierzynski revealed that he and other Sox teammates at the time were involved in a video montage aimed at recruiting LeBron James to sign with the Bulls.
